0: However the restaraunt staff was inept at best
All rooms should be provided with free breakfast
Ate on property all meals in the club lounge on the second floor
Breakfast closed really early on a Sunday 10 am
The pillows were too soft and the restaurant closed early before we could get breakfast
We also did miss the presence of spa services although we casually looked for a spa menu and spa button on the phone and concluded that it must not be offered
did not like that breakfast closed at 10AM on a weekend
There are multiple restaurants near by and a bar on premise
I will simply mention that the food is horrid no room service and the bar is filled with ladies of the night
I searched for the menu in the room could not find one
1: The bar at the top is a no miss You can enjoy a nice variety of wines and drinks while looking at the gigantic windows
Food We frequented the breakfast buffet one morning all wonderful and well done
Skybar is nice but busy and expensive
The rooftop bar offers a great view but it can get crowded
On my final evening he offered me a smores dessert
I planned to order room service for lunch while on conference calls
To make “ more convenient “ the breakfast room has been moved from a spacious place upstairs to the sport bar near the reception area
Great venue but you are better off getting your own drinks at the bar
We went up to the 39th floor The View bar
did not eat in the hotel so can not comment on the restaurants although we did have a charcuterie plate in the bar which was excellent
2: I am eating a leftover granola bar from the bottom of my backpack

Good location but was not told be expedia that there was a strike at the hotel and there where protesters outside day and night banging drums also no restaurant onsite wr had a very bad stay and will be complaing
3: I checked in and the guy in front desk did n’t tell me the bar is closing at 11 pm instead of 1 am because of strike
Lobby restaurant food and service was terrible
The restaurant was closed for remodel
The 39 floor bar is pricey and packed but a very nice place for a drink
Restaurant meal was “ meh ” but the staff in the Platinum Lounge were very helpful
You can order from your room via tablet or calling to B5 the restaurant downstairs BUT you need to go pick it up yourself
I wish breakfast was included and that valet parking could be cheaper though public parking is way cheaper
I wish they had in room dining bu they do have one of the best markets in the lobby
I explained that The Green Papaya should not be an offering for this hotel and I questioned how many other guests were charged for meals ordered that day that could not be fulfilled
If you do not have any choice for breakfast use Trader Joes across the 4th Street
